These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and dense foliage. They produce showy, often pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Parablechnum species are adapted to grow in rocky or well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions. Their botanical features make them popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and resilience.
